title: Mitchell Trubisky returns at quarterback for Chicago Bears after shoulder injury
text:
CLOSE Check out some early NFL headlines. USA TODAY

CHICAGO -- Mitchell Trubisky is back at quarterback for the Chicago Bears.

Trubisky was greeted with cheers when he trotted onto the field and threw a couple of warm-up passes before Sunday's game against the New Orleans Saints. His return was expected after he practiced every day this week.

"He's very close," Bears coach Matt Nagy said Friday. "I feel more comfortable right now than I did on Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, yesterday. He has stacked good days together."

Trubisky injured his non-throwing (left) shoulder three weeks ago during the first series against the Minnesota Vikings. He accompanied the Bears to London for their Oct. 6 game against the Oakland Raiders, but did not play.

Bears quarterback Mitchell Trubisky warms before the game against the Saints on Sunday as he returns from an injury. (Photo: Matt Marton, Matt Marton-USA TODAY Sports)

Chicago had a bye last weekend.

Trubisky has not played particularly well this season -- he has a 65 percent completion rate and a quarterback rating of 81 -- but the Bears hope his return will be a spark for their sputtering offense. Chicago ranks near the bottom of the league in almost every significant offensive statistic, and it cannot afford to fall even further behind in the NFC North.
description: The Chicago Bears lost to the Oakland Raiders two weeks ago with Mitchell Trubisky on the sidelines with an injury to his non-throwing shoulder.
